text: This was our first trip to Lagos, though we've been to the Algarve before. We stayed 5 nights at Belmar and it was great, everything we wanted. Friendly staff at reception, good parking, nice one bedroom apartment with full kitchen, washer (key for all our laundry) large balcony overlooking the adult pool and the beach/ocean. Excellent buffet breakfast. Lots of families here, and ideal for that, though just a great overall base to stay and enjoy the Lagos area. Many excellent restaurants in the town, on the beach and in nearby Portimao. Our favorite beach was praia palmares. Also, close to praia camilo, one of the famous beaches down in the cliffs.

The stay was for two adults and one child (age 7)I am pleased to write a review as we have had a fantastic holiday overall.ConsSubstantial mattresses. My partner didn't sleep well, but I was not so bad.That's ITProsEverything else: the staff are excellent, the entertainment fantastic, and the pools fabulous.Book you won't regret it !!

The Quinta Mirabela boasts 5 star rating and in our opinion has every right to do so.The Quinta Mirabela has managed, successfully, to combine friendly service and personal touch with all the requisite facilities for a 5 star hotel. From the moment we arrived, we felt completely relaxed and at home in the hotel and found the amenities and service to be excellent. On arrival we were presented with a cool glass of the most lovely sparkling wine and this subsequently turned out to be just one of the many \personal touch\" experiences that made our stay so enjoyable.Breakfast is a self service buffet of truly generous proportions
month: supplemented with any type \"eggs to order\" from the kitchen and for the truly adventurous
year: sparkling wine is available at the buffet every morning! A continental breakfast can be taken on the balcony
extracted_date: if preferred.The restaurant has a locally renowned reputation to live up to and we experienced a superb candlelit dinner on the last night of our stay. We found the service to be professional
year_int: courteous and friendly.The location of the hotel is truly breathtaking
column12: south facing and with private balconies plus a swimming pool/sun lounge area and roof garden all affording superb views over Funchal harbour and the Atlantic Ocean as well as the surrounding areas on all sides. As if that were not enough
column13: the hotel is situated on the road used to convey tourists by Toboggan down the hill from the Tropical Gardens at Monte.Access to the town is easily achieved by taxi (around 12Euro from the hotel) or by bus No.19 bus (>2 Euro per person) from the stop 5 minutes walk down the hill.The Toboggan station
column15: is also situated a short distance downhill from the hotel.Whilst it is possible to walk into Funchal (about 30mins)
column16: this is definitely NOT recommended as the road is dangerously steep and narrow in places believe me
column17: we tried it and were thankfully rescued
column19: by a very concerned taxi driver!!We booked a \"superior\" room and our 7 night stay at the Quinta Mirabela was wonderful
column20: we would not hesitate to recommend it to our friends and relatives."

text: Just got back from a weeks holiday here with my partner.The staff were so welcoming when we arrived and absolutely lovely throughout the whole week.The room was really nice and clean, as well as the rest of the hotel (I‚Äôve seen some reviews about the carpets although they are cleaned often they are just stained) I personally don‚Äôt think I‚Äôd want to be in the lower rooms (we was 4th floor)The rooftop bar was beautiful and so relaxing.We stayed for a week and got one free meal in two restaurants. The first restaurant ‚Äúalecrin‚Äù was really nice, and 100% worth a visit.However the ‚Äútaverna Portuguesa‚Äù was a bit of a let down in comparison we just got a plate of chicken which was fine considering it was free.The only let down for me was the food, it was often cold and boring, Which is to be expected at all inclusive I suppose.The drinks they served were named spirits instead of cheap stuff which I thought was a bonus.Overall had an amazing time, and will definitely be returning with my daughter as there was so much stuff for children there!üôÇ

Ideal for kids to keep them entertained as there is a lot todo although the food selection for them isn‚Äôt the best at tea time all in all a very good hotel staff are amazing and never any problems this is the second time we stayed and I would stay again

Weve just returned from portugal, having stayed one week in the Jupiter hotel. The rooms are very clean,  animation team , slides and splash pool brilliant. The pools absolutely freezing, however this didn't stop kids from having fun.Downside of the week was the constant ques we had to stand in every night to get into the main resteraunt, it didn't matter what time you went there was a que to get in, a que then for the food, a que for the desserts. We had to wait a while to get drinks and hardly ever got top ups...one night I was shown to my table it was very busy so my husband stood In the que to get our food and I took our kids to get there food to return to our table to find people sitting there, I didn't want to make a fuss as the family had a baby and a toddler. I then had to tell the manager he had given our table to someone else, he apologised and because it was so busy and no free tables we were told there was tables outside. It was freezing cold, but outside we had to sit.The food and drink was nice, however it does need to looked at when the hotel is busy there should be more food stations. The a la carte was lovely, it's a shame tou could only have one visit. The pizza snack bar was lovely, freshly made, a big hit with the kids.We have had a lovely stay and would recommend this hotel, however be prepared for the ques.

Fantastic hotel for children.Hotel without the capacity to accommodate so many people.30 minutes to check in.Chaotic dinners and breakfasts, very small space for the purpose.I chose dinner with drinks included and paid ‚Ç¨510 for 2 nights in December.I paid ‚Ç¨1.90 for a coffee. I paid ‚Ç¨2.70 for a small bottle of water. In coffee it is ready, but in water it is unacceptable.
Rooms were clean , roomy with excellent service , Buffet food was good, A la carte restaurant wasn't that great. overall a decent enjoyable experience.

Behind these historic walls, we have poorly designed rooms (small bathroom with toilet not completely closed) and poorly maintained (out-of-service socket, plumbing problem). The service is insufficient (water, in-room coffee not refilled) In the restaurant, the staff is unfriendly.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: Ideal location, beautiful, intimate hotel with an incredible staff.  Very knowledgeable and engaging. Excellent service! Enjoyed our room. Very Comfortable and spacious.  The interior design of the hotel is outstanding. Feels like you are staying in a luxury townhouse in the best location in Lisbon.  Excellent restaurant.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: Uneasy to find one single topic to start with as the whole experience was perfect. Welcoming, warm and helpfull staff. Great room - wonderful bed and bathroom - perfectly calm with view on the patio garden, perfect place to have a drink. The lobby and the corridor lead to surprises, tastefully decorated spaces or nice works of art. Great breakfast with an exceptional pancake and a friendly team. We loved it.

We spent a week in a 3rd floor apartment - excellently serviced and fully equipped for our needs. Wonderful pool and helpful hotel staff. Conveniently located in a quiet street between the old town and The Strip, with easy access to beach, restaurants and shops.

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: After deciding to stay another day on vacation, I chose the D Filipa hotel for its location.Despite having arrived early, I went to the hotel to find out if it was possible to leave my luggage there.I was received by a young woman who didn't speak Portuguese and who had some difficulty looking for the data requested on my citizenship card, asking her colleague and as if she were seeing such a document for the first time.I left my luggage, went to the beach and came back to prepare for dinner out, with little time left.When I opened the bedroom door, I saw that they hadn't brought my suitcase there.After a brief evaluation, I was able to verify that I was completely deceived and misled by what I had observed on Booking.An unpleasant room, completely dated and out of fashion, with dilapidated and uncomfortable furniture.If I hadn't made the reservation myself, I would have been convinced that I was staying in a modest guest house in the interior of the country...In addition to not having remote-controlled air conditioning (which forced me to get out of bed several times during the night), the bed had been moved but its headboard remained attached to the wall. The old lamps, without reading lights or wall switches. Bathroom with plastic curtain and blocked sink. So as not to extend myself any further. I have never stayed in a hotel like this in my entire life. And I can say that I've traveled a lot and know hotels in almost the entire world, with fewer stars and much more pleasant.The breakfast is quite modest, unacceptable for a 5-star hotel and for the amount charged.The only positive feature of this hotel, which doesn't even have any merit, is its location.

We were slightly disappointed with this hotel - it didn't quite live up to expectations, but having said that, there are a number of plus points:Location - fabulous views out to sea, especially from the outdoor infinity pool area, which has glass panels to shield from the (quite strong) breezes and is generally lovely.The restaurant is very good. We had several very enjoyable lunches and dinners in addition to the excellent breakfasts.The staff are friendly and generally helpful.The gardens are lovely and well maintained.On the negative side the hotel is beginning to show signs of wear and tear. It is shabby in places and not as clean as it should be. More attention to detail needed here.We had a problem with noisy ventilation system which we reported and were told that this happens 'often'! To be fair, it did quieten down later at night for some mysterious reason.The bar staff weren't as good as they should have been- very slow and got one order horribly wrong.A good hotel, but needs a review to keep standards higher.

Travelled from Australia to surf. Stayed for only 3 nights, wish i had stayed more. The rooms are incredibly clean. 4 to a room (in all rooms, I believe). The beds are comfy and as clean as my bed at home. It is obvious the rooms and communal areas are highly maintained and kept clean.Full size range of wetsuits to hire as well as soft top surfboards for beginners. They have a small amount of epoxy fish/hybrid boards which were more than enough to have some fun sessions on. If you are picky/want to surf Supertubos etc just bring your own board. Both beaches are only a 10~ minute walk. Perfect for going for a quick wave before breakfast/after dinner.The breakfast served every morning was beautiful; fresh coffee, fresh rolls with spreads and cereal. There is also a supermarket with every thing you keed only a 2-3 minute walk away. All rooms have private fridges too.Can‚Äôt wait to come back - thanks so much for an awesome, awesome stay.Tom

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: Friendly and knowledgeable staff, excellent facilities.Stayed here after a cycling trip in northern Portugal.Nothing was too much trouble and restaurantrecommendation-Sr Lisboa- was fabulous.Thoroughly enjoyed the intimate Fado  performance in the hotel dining area.

In Convento da Proven√ßa the weekend tastes like small vacations. The staff is very kind and helpful and the rooms very clean and comfortable. On a hot August weekend the pool is the place to be. Our only remark goes to the lack of some tradicional products at breakfast like regional cheeses.

We couldn‚Äôt fault our short break, staff friendly, hotel clean, food good, opera night amazing ü§©Forte do Vale in our opinion was the  best hotel for couples. We visited the other MGM hotels in the area and we feel we chose well.There was nothing not to like, I would definitely recommend to anyone that doesn‚Äôt like to complain about the smallest things. Xxx.

We have been staying at this hotel for several times: the location is great (quiet), staff is most friendly, the hotel is comfortable with nice swimmingpool and restaurant and it has an unique historical 'background' (small village where fishermen and their families lived who fished for the albacora tuna fish). The old, school, chapel and houses have been restored with good sense of cultural value. There is one thing you should know: because of the tide and the salt lakes, you frequently sense an intense smell of... mud. It can be so intense that you can not open your windows at that time.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: We had a fabulous stay 18-25th November 2023, wonderful food especially the breakfasts and Villa Cipriani which were awesome, brilliant location and facilities, professional service by a wonderful group of people. We will be back.

Great place for alternative travelers! The crew is very informative and helpful, the rooms are beautiful (also a bit small) and the breakfasts are the best. The price is not so cheap for Lisbon but worth it.

Stayed at the Marriott for the 1st time for 3 nights whilst on business.Overall was very impressed and would definitely stay again. Check in was quick and efficient, room was a good size and very clean and in good condition.Service was very good and the on site gym was also pretty good for a hotel. Some free weights and a couple of benches and a cable machine as well as the normal assortment of cardio machines.The only thing letting it down slightly was location. To go anywhere outside of the hotel needs a car or taxi ride. Taxi's are in plentiful supply but would have preferred to just walk somewhere.

Beautiful room, lovely rooftop views, very nice staff.The rooftop area was lovely and had great views over the river but wine was very expensive and unnecessarily so.Dinner was very tasty and delicious but child size portions and so expensive for the portion size. No nice  nearby restaurants to walk too. I would stay here again as it was lovely but I would not eat dinner there. No good shopping area nearby but that didn‚Äôt bother me for this trip

I stayed 4 nights here, including the night of the UEFA Champions League final. It is well-located, though a little noisy on the back side, due to the proximity of a multi-lane freeway.The reception area is large, and extremely busy. One reason may be that free wifi connection is available there (oddly, not generally in the rooms themselves). It is a nice space for a coffee, with an outdoor balcony area for smokers.The room was a little disappointing. The carpet was a worn synthetic fibre, which was quite prickly to walk on in bare feet. No minibar, though that wasn't an issue for me. The bathroom was small, with a shower over the bath. The king size bed was very comfortable, though the pillows left a lot to be desired; a choice of either rock-hard, or ridiculously soft and unsupportive.The location is probably not too remote from the city centre during normal traffic, but it took more than a half hour to drive to St. George's castle on the eve of the football final.

This is a great hotel all what you need rooms are lovely plenty of space staff was wonderful helpful and friendly food was great very central walking to the square great sports bar right outside the door

outstanding resort,have been coming to Four Seasons Fairways for years and love it.both our villas are beautiful ,well equipped,clean with lovely furnishings,beds are heavenly. food in restaurant is excellant and pool bar is good value,staff are brilliant always friendly and helpful.shop on site is so handy,and this year the bus service to beach was great.every year we wish we could stay longer.

Fantastic hotel, great location and friendly staff....just got back from a 7 night stay at the oceano and I have to say one of the best places I've stayed at for a long time, rooms cleaned every day the hotel itself was spotless, pool area was the same with quality sunbeds and a great decked bar area with quality chairs and tables, we went for a forth floor one bed apartment and it was massive with all you need plus a good sized balcony with pool and sea views and you even got free wi fi in your rooms.......super, location wise your a 20 minutes walk from the strip and about 25 minutes from the old town which is where we spent every night apart from the night we went to the strip, my advice is use the taxis as it costs less than 5 euros to ether the strip or the oldtown....we will be going back to the oceano thats for sure.......thanx oceano for a great week....p.s the beach was 10 minutes walk from the oceano and is really good , sunbeds are 5 euros per day with a free umbrella. ......have fun

Royal Savoy and Madeira is the hole familys favorite place for summerholyday. We realy enjoy being there. Climate is perfect. Funcal is a friendly city with a lot of good restaurants and bars. Since 2004 we have visited Royal Savoy and Madeira every year. Except 2020 because of covid. We look forward to be back.

Lovely rooms and good views. Staff were friendly and happy to help. Main downside for our stay was the buffet restaurant where food was often not very hot and it took a long time for staff to take our drinks orders. For this reason I wouldn't stay half board again in future.

So many of the other reviews capture the essence of the place: beautiful, calm, comfortable, friendly, homey. This hotel and its staff are a delight.  Value relative to cost is off the charts.Special shoutout to the front of house staff for wonderful restaurant recommendations and for quickly processing our room after checkout and calling my cell phone immediately to inform me of items we left behind that could have otherwise ruined a travel day.

People were friendly but the housekeeping was terrible for the price.  The sign says \leave towels on the floor if you want replaced.\"  We came back to a completely  unclean room or at least dirty towels STILL on the floor several afternoons.  The coffee station was not always replenished.  Also the recommended tour for Fatima and Colimbre was led by a man named Yugo
month: who was less than knowledgeable of the attractions.  He parked so far from the entrance at Fatima and only gave us an hour to tour.  By then he was well aware that one person in our party had difficulty walking!"

text: When I travel I enjoy staying at higher-end hotels because I love a place to retreat to at the end of the day. I've stayed at the Four Seasons in Chicago, Maui, Beverly Hills and the Miraval resorts.  This place completely topped those accomodations by 5x.  The palace felt historical, regal but also uniquely home-y.The staff (shoutout to Claudia, Josef, Sofia and Joanna) - were SO sweet. They were accomodating in setting us up with portable convertors and calling restaurants for availability for dinner. Claudio even took me and my friends' picture in the stairwell (he was a great photographer!)The breakfast at this place was incredibly posh and the coffee was to die for. If you're even hesitating -just book it.

Excellent hotel, reception team was super helpfull. Restaurant staff could be more faster and customer oriented. Location was a little bit far from capital but the peacefullnes and views compensate that. One of the best hotels we have ever been!

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: One of the increasingly rare hotels where you can get communicating rooms at all levels of price. Very comfortable, excellent lighting, bathrooms, armchairs, mirrors and balconies with views of garden and sea. And, most importantly for us, very quiet indeed.Other guests not unbearably glitzy which makes a change in a 5 star hotel.Staff  very friendly, helpful and well-mannered with one exception at the reception check in.Buffet lunch expensive but good. Cipriani restaurant part of the hotel with wonderful view from tables on the terrace. Food good but not exceptional.The island is very beautiful especially on the north coast and the ocean extremely warm in September.

Definitely beautiful building and spacious rooms but avoid room number 15 especially in summer. You cannot use the balcony or open your windows because of the noise and smell of the restaurant ventilation. Also, the air conditioning made noises even when it was off.There is not enough place in bathroom to place your personal belongings. Nice bed, sheets and room are very clean. Walls are thin and you hear everything in the corridor.Breakfast is very nice.We didnt try the restaurant because there is no option a la carte.

Excellent hotel! Very efficient and attentive staff!Location 30 m from Av Liberdade, impeccable service and cleanliness! They helped me pick up a pair of tennis shoes I had forgotten at another hotel and pack a travel purchase. Excellent restaurant, highlighting the waitress Cl√©o. All very nice!

Having read on this site a comment from someone about the showers (negative) we were somewhat concerned as this is a really important factor when camping.....please let me re-assure anyone thinking of coming here...the showersblocks are first rate!  plenty of hot water (no push buttons) lovely large cubicles with hanging space and best of all VERY clean....the ladies on cleaning duty should be (and have been by myself) commended as the site is sandy/dusty (due to its situation) and so to keep these facilities so pristine must be hard work.  The toilets have seats and paper, and being in the same blocks as equally as clean.We asked (twice) for the pool to be cleaned - bits and pieces in there not looking so great...and this was done, and yesterday we were swimming in a HUGE pool having it all to ourselves!...blissThis site is large and rambling with plenty of pretty trees and you can hear many birds singing and indeed there are swallows nesting in the washing area...so there is plenty of pitch space -your choice where to camp up, shade or sun according to your choice.  We are only paying just over 14 euros to include camper van, 2 adults, electricity and internet....what's not to like?

Breakfast was good and the hotel is in a convenient location but the room was AWFUL. We have never stayed in such an expensive hotel with such cramped accommodation. There was barely room for a double bed. Basically a large en suite cupboard. Nothing like the photos would suggest. Avoid

We were on a stag do, one of the days we relaxed at the pool. We had an amazing experience with the MGM entertainment team (Nirma and Leyanna). They had all sorts fun installed for us including water polo, dance class and water exercise.  The energy is unmatched √∞≈∏≈í≈∏√∞≈∏≈í≈∏√∞≈∏≈í≈∏√∞≈∏≈í≈∏√∞≈∏≈í≈∏

Rute Trinidad is a wonderful host. She and her team have amazing customer service beyond anything in this great country. The view is spectacular. They always have a smile and will do anything for their guests.
Best 4 stars h√¥tel ever tried. Breath-taking view on the coast from the room. Excellent services and breakfast ! A must go !

Overall the Natura was very good. Only downsides were the extra charges that seemed to apply to everything and when a member of reception staff was asked about our transfers to the airport they were not friendly or helpful. Plus sides were that the apartments, pool and bar area were all very clean and the hotel is very peaceful. I would stay at this hotel again because I loved the albufeira area.

I spent three nights in the Hotel Gat Rossio in Lisbon and will definitely recommend it to my friends.  It‚Äôs right in the centre, close to the shopping area.  The Aerobus to and from the airport stops about 200 metres away (Eur3.50 each way), Rossio Metro station is a similar distance and Rossio railway station is just across the road.The hotel d√©cor is young, fresh and bright.  The rooms are small with funky furniture that is very functional (except for hanging trousers!).  The shower worked really well and there were nice toiletries plus a ‚Äúhotel-style‚Äù hairdryer.  Everything was really clean.  The reception staff are friendly and helpful and there is a computer in the reception area for all to use free of charge (great for on-line flight check-ins).  The breakfast area has tables and padded benches ‚Äì that doesn‚Äôt sound great, but in fact it‚Äôs really comfortable and, again, very practical.  Breakfast is buffet-style with the usual fruit and juice, bread/toast, rolls, boiled eggs, cold meat, cheese, pastries, cakes and coffee/tea etc. and, like everything else, it‚Äôs well laid out and appealing.The Gat Rossio is located on a narrow side street surrounded by restaurants.  My room was at the front of the hotel and I was glad to be able to close the shutters at night to block out whatever noise there was.  The Sol Dourado Restaurant (two doors up) was recommended by the hotel receptionist and the food there was very good.If I‚Äôm ever in Lisbon again I will most definitely stay at the Gat Rossio.

Awesome place with exceptional service. The staff were super helpful and friendly and the hotel is located in a perfect spot overlooking the beach and for watching the local surf. We looked forward to the breakfasts every day. Azeem‚Äôs omelettes were perfect. The menus between the hotel restaurant and the beach hut were great as were the weekly bbq‚Äôs and sunset DJ sets. The rooms are very well designed and cool even during hot weather. The surfing classes and the team providing them are excellent. There is plenty of space to relax and lounge inside or out peacefully at any time of the day. From start to finish we felt so welcome. We enjoyed our stay so much here we are already booked to return in 2020. If you are thinking of visiting Noah Surf House then seriously stop thinking and just reserve a room before they‚Äôre gone!

Good value, clean and well run. All staff accommodating, friendly , hard working and helpful.Food:Breakfast is well organised, less busy prior to 9am.Lunch basics , week cooked and presented.Dinner ; this was more unpredictable. Seafood theme good, Italian Eve not so.A relaxed dining feel. Plates get cleared away as soon as you leave them unattended- leave clues you still want them.Day:Grounds well cared for and spacious. At this time of year no early reserved beds, so it was good to have a leisurely breakfast and then head to the pool. Pool clean , salt water. Beds towards end of garden / cliff lovely and wuiet , plenty of shade from trees also.Room: we had a room with kitchenette and although next to lift we actually found it quiet , facing road we got a the beautiful late afternoon sun on balcony. Fridge and microwave.Out and about : local restaurants good: tip book is you can as they get busy. Cliff walks great especially at start or end of day. Walk to town worth is , as are all the coves and small beaches.Downside : credit / debit cards. Whatever the reason more times than not, they are declined or yhe ‚Äònet‚Äô is problematic ( duty managers response when we complained- the response did not explained or resolve issue). Internet works , so it isn‚Äôt that. Many people resort to cash , but you can pay up at reception. An alternative is to arrange to have charges to room - but this entails ‚Ç¨25 per person per day as an advance on card. This is then adjusted : however this would incur further exchange charges.All in all a good choice in a beautiful location. Lots of hills , slopes and steps to beaches.Unlike Britain Portugal is still very much a cash society in this area.

Modern, nice, great staff and very good service. Placed in center of Lisbon I recommend this hotel to everybody!! The staff very nice and allways ready to help, I think is the most important. The \terraza\" near of restaurant a great place to take a drink in the afternoon. The rooms very confortables and with a modern decoration

hotel_name: Porto Pal√É¬°cio Hotel by The Editory
text: Friendly staff, lovely room. No complaints :) Room was large and beds really comfy.  Rooms well air conditioned also compared to other really warm hotel rooms. Cleaned every day to a high standard and even chocolates left on our bed after the clean :)

We acquired an alveole for 1 tent, we are a family with teenage children/adults. We are regular customers, but at this time there is little control in the noise of the night, and the cars are circulating through the park and no one controls the silence time, including dismantling tents at 00:30 and no one verifies the same situation. This year was different and something confusing.

The hotel rooms and it's views were amazing. However, the spa staff's professionalism and attentiveness were the highlight of my hotel stay. Even though their schedule was packed, I manage to book a same day reservation. My masseuse made me feel relaxed and created a comfortable environment for me during my session. I will definitely use Altis Belem's hotel Spa services in the near future.

The hotel is located in the santa clara district in the lowest flat area of coimbra. The hotel is new reorganized and rooms are nice (even if are small). In general i suggest this place for short stay and in period of No student party (festa das latas e queima das fitas) the risk is insomnia. The hotel is cheap but honestly I think that the breakfast is too much poor for the standard rate.

Read the reviews on here before we went and this helped to manage our holiday expectations.So hope this helps you.Not a 5 star place but not paying 5 star prices.The appartments were clean and tidy. Kitchen dated but everything worked.Air con in the living room and in bedroom which was great.Kitchen - BasicBathroom - BasicLiving area - NiceBalcony - better than expected.Swimming pool was nice and if you could not get a sunbed there was lots of grass area to lay towels out.The staff were polite so our experience was different to the feedback given by others.Internet access so kids had daily fix of facebook.No noise really after midnight and staff make sure younger groups adhere to this. People do come home in early hours. They are quiet and this is managed by night staff.Food prices at pool bar were reasonable 5 euros for chessbuger and chips.Top of the road turn left 150 yards and on the right there is a supermarket.Top of road American Diner reasonably priced.Top of road and opposite was a takeaway which did kebabs, pizza, chips, burgers all resonably priced if that's what you want.Top of road turn left and 50 yards on the right is Annabels. Reasonably priced English restaurant that also did a good breakfast for between 2 and 3.5 euros according to choice.Strip was a 10 minute walk away.Old town 30 minutes further on than the strip. worth the walk. Long cue to get a taxi back so we walked.Best local beach left at top of the road, at roundabout turn left 20 minute walk in total. The one to the right was rocky in the water - This is a 15 minute walk..Zoo marine good for a day trip. Do shop about though before booking. Agent next to supermarket we found to be cheapest

I stayed here in Feb 2014 for a winter sun holiday. The food was served buffet style, as is often the case in similar hotels, but the hot food was hot and the cold food was cold, which is not always the case elsewhere. There was a good range of food, from lovely salads through nicely cooked main meals, to desserts and cheeses. My room was great - clean and spacious enough. I had a balcony looking over the pool, around which the hotel is built. The pool is nice, though no one was braving it at that time of year, though plenty were sitting out in the sun on the sunbeds. The weather was good and warm and I was almost tempted to try the pool but opted for the inside pool in the spa part of the hotel. Another day I had a massage in the spa at a reasonable price. All the staff were pleasant and helpful. There is little evening entertainment at that time of year, at least. Perhaps there is some in other seasons.The area is good for bird spotting on the salinas nearby. Because of local geography (Tavira is on a river whose mouth is sheltered by Tavira Island), you need to get a boat to the best beach, which is on the island. These run regularly and more so in summer months. It is only a short trip to this beautiful extensive beach.The town is quite old, and on both sides of the river. It is not very large and if you don't mind walking, you can stroll around taking in the historical sites, including the castle, the old bridge and the old fish market. There is a little train on wheels that you can take around the town if you don't want to walk. You can stay on for the full tour of about 45-60 minutes. The driver stops at picturesque points for photographs. Or you can hop on and off at places you want to see. There are cafes, bars and small shops of all kinds to browse.I'll be going again. I was only there for a week and it wasn't enough!

Central location, clean and tidy, friendly staff are very positive sides.No indoor restaurant except from a drinks bar, but with the amount of restaurants in the surroundings, itis not really negative.Limited car parking, but since you dont want to drive in Porto, it does not really matter.And you are in walking distance to most of the important bits.Will stay there again when in Porto next time.

It√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s always a pleasure return to this site. It√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s an oasis in the midle of nowhere. This is one of those properties that you seek when you need to relax and recharge. There are birds and other animals around you to enjoy the wonderful landscape.But if you only want a very good and calm restaurant, with a tasteful cuizine, this os also the place. A very polite staff and wonderful food with a beautiful view . Don√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t forget to apreciate all of this, with a very good wine produced in this reagion. We will go back for sure! √¢¬ù¬§√Ø¬∏¬è

We went in the off season.  The hotel was quiet.  The spa facilities were nice.  The indoor pool with the waterfall looked great, but swimming, you kept bumping into the underwater pedestal that held the waterfall up.  The hot tub was only slightly hot, and the sauna just great.  The outdoor pool was not useable, it was too cold.  The grounds were lovely, great for strolling.  On sunny days, it is nice to sit on the lounges.  The breakfast buffet was included with our package.  Lot of selection, the usual cold cereal, variety of cold meat and cheese, bread, lots of seasonal fruit.  Sausages and scrambled eggs, baked beans.  However, the selection is the same every day.  Desk clerks were very helpful and personable.  I would recommend the hotel but in the off season there are very few restaurants close by.  You have to go to next town Armacao de Pera to get a good selection.

Was just there for one night on the end of a week long trip to Portugal. Chose the hotel as it is very close to a number of port lodges. Jorge at the front desk greeted us with a welcoming smile. Upgraded our room and took care of parking the car. What more can one ask!? Thx again Jorge.

The cliff bay is a lovely hotel great food and staff. The location is perfect, we would recommend a bay view room. Sitting on the balcony with a night cap watching the comings and goings perfect way to end the day.

Very easy to reach this hotel by car. It's easy to park near the hotel but if you want to go for a walk and to leave the car for all day, it's more convenient to pay the parking offered by the hotel. Hotel is very well located. Museu Calouste Gulbenkian can be reached in 5 minutes. The neighbourhood is pretty nice. Breakfast is very goog and the room is also comfortable. Wi-fi Works perfectly.

The restaurants is very authentic Indian cuisine thanks to Mahesh and Ajay who accompanied us.The food quality it nice.Pan puri is juice ways to start the thali.Thanks to all the staffThanks again to Mahesh and Ajay you guys made our trip and will recommend our family

We stayed at Casa do Cabe√ßo for a whole week and it was superb. Our hosts, Marta and Iker are perfect hosts who give great attention to detail and they are so kind and friendly. Our stay was much more than just comfortable and welcoming - it actually felt like it was our home too!  Dexter and Dylan, the gorgeous setters, made up for us missing our own dogs and the shady, peaceful ambience of the garden was a delight. The meals were delicious - made with imagination, great skill and the best ingredients. We decided immediately to have dinner there each evening, outside on the pretty terrace. The menu was exciting and varied - Iker was more than happy to recommend and suggest which is so helpful when confronted with such a fabulous  choice! Marta and Iker are also great tour guides and sent us many links to interesting places that we would otherwise have missed. This is a beautiful part of Portugal and Casa do Cabe√ßo is in an excellent, peaceful location within easy reach of famous cities and landmarks. We cannot recommend this very special place more highly and hope we can return one day.

Our stay , in May 2019 was excellent. The breakfasts were fantastic . All of our group felt comfortable at all times. We chose to have dinner in other areas of the island . The sights and sounds on the grounds were well above expectations. Even the fish in the pond , greeted us every morning. Great value for your money.

Marvelous place to stay in the center of Sintra with big beautiful common area. Extremely friendly and accommodating staff. Very spacious rooms beautifully decorated . Excellent breakfast with wide choice of fresh food. Outdoor pool with outstanding view. The place is so relaxing that next time we book it for a longer period!

date: Dave M I owrote a review Oct 2014
text: Modern hotel with spa on 23rd floor, which has great views over the River Tagus. Bedroom very modern, with shower and jacuzzi, and integrated Bluetooth so you can play your own music. Breakfast good, inside or out, and hotel shaped like a ship front, so you feel like you're sailing without moving!

Stayed in Vila Gale for two nights during our trip to Portugal. This hotel is modern, with nice, clean, and spacious rooms and great breakfast option (we had it included to the price). Comfortable beds and nice size bathrooms. The hotel also had a great pool with the Turkish baths and sauna for their guests. The Internet connection sometimes was spotty, but managed to hold on. The location is not very convinient though as it was about a 20 min walk to to the city center, 5 min taxi ride to the train station. There were several nice restaurants nearby and we got some good recommendations from the front desk upon arriving. Would definitely recommend!
Lovely hotel excellent staff,and location food in dining room lovely but breakfast quality needs improved.

The hotel is located at a dead end street across from an apartment and a pile of rubble. I had a lovely balcony as long as i did not look down. It looked up the hill to the university and to the river off to the right. And over a big pile of rubble and crud. Some rooms overlook the river and pool. Not sure why they didnt put us in one of those rooms with a view. The hotel did not have many guests at that time.The rooms are very nice, clean, and comfortable. There was no furniture on the spacious balcony so we dragged chairs out from inside to enjoy our happy hour of local wine and olives.The pool is very nice and there are lots of lounge chairs and umbrellas.Breakfast buffet was nice.It was not a long walk to the university or riverfront but was not real scenic along the way.There is parking in an attached garage for a reasonable fee.

From the outside, Bellevue apartments don't look anything special, just a plain whitewashed building on the corner of a road junction. Situated just outside the main town centre which is literally a 5 minute amble away,it has a small minimarket across the road and the first of many restaurants which lead into the town..We stayed in apartment 9 which is the basic self catering accommodation. It was immaculately clean with a well appointed kitchen with towels being changed every couple of days..We asked to have a look round the larger apartments which were even better than no.9 with fantastic views over the pool and garden area to the sea.The owners are lovely people and can't do enough to be of assistance at any time..It was our first time in Portugal and can't wait to book next year's holiday..here..

Wasn‚Äôt expecting such a lovely hotel for the price. We stayed in three hotels during our holiday and this was by far the best and not the most expensive. Had a room on fourth floor with balcony. It was spacious and comfortable with plenty of storage space. Breakfast was very good in a light and attractive restaurant. Public rooms comfy and inviting. The pool was the icing on the cake. Large and lots of sun loungers. Staff very helpful and friendly. Cannot fault this hotel.
